body:
I'm not opposed to adding `--files-without-matches`, but I don't think we need to add a short alias for it. I'd at least like to keep `-L` for following symlinks.

I'm also not opposed to making `-v` a bit smarter with respect to whether `-l` is given or not, but I worry that it will make "find files with a line that doesn't match" impossible to do.
Ha, I almost added this earlier @mernen but ran into exactly the problem you described ðŸ˜„

OK, so I did some more thinking about this and I think the _current_ behavior of `-lv` is probably the right one. I totally get that it can be confusing, but `-v` pretty solidly refers to matching at the line level and isn't a generic "do the opposite" flag. In particular, `grep -lv` behaves the same as `rg -lv`.

Here is a proposed specification.

Add a new flag `--files-without-matches`. Only show the path of each file that contains zero matches.

issue.title: Add --files-without-matches flag.

repository.name: ripgrep
repository.description: ripgrep recursively searches directories for a regex pattern while respecting your gitignore

issue.body:
Performs the opposite of `--files-with-matches`: only shows paths of files that contain zero matches.

Closes #138.

---

This is a rather quick-and-dirty patch: I had zero familiarity with the codebase, and I basically searched for `files.with.matches` to guide me where changes should be made. I've tried to match the overall code style, but I may have missed something.

body: (If, like me, you're coming here from Google, the flag that made it into ripgrep is `--files-without-match`)

issue.title: Include "--files-without-matches" in rg-menu

repository.name: rg.el
repository.description: Emacs search tool based on ripgrep

issue.body:
Is it possible to include `--files-without-matches` switch in rg-menu?

Info on the switch - https://github.com/BurntSushi/ripgrep/issues/138

issue.title: invert live_grep

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Enhancement to performance, inner workings or existent features

repository.name: telescope.nvim
repository.description: Find, Filter, Preview, Pick. All lua, all the time.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I often want to generate a list of all files which do not contain `String A`. Grep has a `-v `option to accomplish this. I think this would be a great feature for Telescope.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A simple way to perform a live invert grep.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I looked over the docs. I do not see an option for invert grep. I'm also unaware of extensions which offer this.

body: I keep coming back here to re-check what the flag is ðŸ˜¢
how can we use this flag in vs code search?
This is the issue tracker for ripgrep. Your question is about VS Code UX. You are in the wrong place.
